children.name: Learning limitations
children.info: Ability to help the identification of knowledge gaps.

children.name: Learning style
children.info: Identification of different learner's learning profiles (auditory, visual and kinesthetic).

children.name: Teaching and learning processes
children.info: Well defined teaching and learning processes used.

children.name: Knowledge effectiveness
children.info: Ability to evaluate the user's effective knowledge acquisition.

children.name: Knowledge at the right time
children.info: Content offered at the correct stage of learning, for the avoidance of a very advanced content that depends on non-gained knowledge.

children.name: Educational activities
children.info: Different types of activities related to education, that enable, for instance, knowledge acquisition, guidance from a tutor, instructions that guide the user during learning.

children.name: Adaptation to the context
children.info: Ability to adapt to the user's context taking into account age, gender, education, physical conditions of the environment, among other context factors.

children.name: Motivation
children.info: Stimuli through which the user acts in relation to knowledge acquisition.

children.name: Engagement
children.info: Functional commitment to roles and responsibilities for the achievement of a goal associated with emotional involvement for the development of such activities.

children.name: Creativity
children.info: Ability to solve tasks and develop ideas differently from the normal pattern for the establishment of a certain purpose.

children.name: Progress monitoring
children.info: Use of a set of information on day-to-day teaching and learning and summative assessments for an overview of the learnerâ€™s progress.

children.name: Quality of content
children.info: Quality content related to situations and problems of learner's interest which is free of misspellings and contains no invasive, negative or discriminating messages.

children.name: Target audience
children.info: Society sector with some common characteristics (age, gender, profession, interests, etc.) to which the application is devoted.

children.name: Multimedia complexity
children.info: Definition of a limit of multimedia elements that do not distract the user.

children.name: Content source
children.info: All available content must be provided by a reliable source.

children.name: Content management
children.info: Control, management and monitoring of the content offered.

children.name: Content integration
children.info: Integration of contents, for a defined flow among them.

children.name: Didactic resources
children.info: Didactic resources that assist the learning process.

children.name: Content reuse
children.info: Ability to reuse content.

children.name: Content complexity
children.info: Gradual adaptation of the content complexity according to the user's level, so that a complex content does not become an obstacle to users' understanding.

children.name: Feedback
children.info: Ability to enable reciprocal feedback between students and teachers.

children.name: Communication among users
children.info: Communication among users (learners, tutors and/or teachers) through blogs, forums, groups, and other media.

children.name: Collaboration
children.info: Collaboration in activities  for the interaction among learners, tutors and teachers through wiki, games, microblogs, forums and groups.

children.name: Cost of the development of the learning material
children.info: Reduction in the learning material creation costs, since they directly influence the application costs and user's investment.

children.name: Time for the development of the learning material
children.info: Adoption of mechanisms that facilitate the creation of learning materials for reductions in the development time.

children.name: Service level
children.info: Establishment of service levels for a safer use of applications and their continuity: (i) continuity plan: recovery strategies and procedures of m-learning environments for the avoidance of interruption of learning practices; (ii) service-level agreement: agreement based on number of participants and materials and application functionalities; and (iii) cost-benefit: viability achieved by low development, acquisition and maintenance costs.

children.name: Trial period
children.info: Availability of a trial period of the application or permission to access the basic functionality to allow the user to try the application before the acquisition.

children.name: Support
children.info: Support to users regarding the services offered by the application.

children.name: User's profile
children.info: Application configurability for treating different possible limitations according to age, gender, religion, race, and other user's characteristics.

children.name: User's satisfaction
children.info: Satisfaction of user's expectations for the avoidance of abandonment and discomfort during the use of the application.

children.name: Communication capacity
children.info: Ability of data transmission between devices.

children.name: Multimedia resources
children.info: Ability to support different types of media, such as video, text, audio, among others.

children.name: Network bandwidth variation
children.info: Ability to adapt to bandwidth variation of the network.

children.name: Separate views
children.info: Supply of different views according to the user's profile (e.g.: teacher, student)

children.name: Functional completeness
children.info: Ability to provide all features expected by users.

children.name: Data transfer
children.info: Ability of data minimization for improving transfer time of connections and number of data transfered.

children.name: Behavior in relation to time
children.info: User's waiting time for the full loading of the requested information.

children.name: Application size
children.info: Amount of space required for the application to be used in the device.

children.name: Memory use efficiency
children.info: Use of techniques that optimize the use of the device's memory.

children.name: Energy consumption efficiency
children.info: Efficient use of energy, given the limitations of the devices' batteries.

children.name: Memory cleaning
children.info: Non storage of unnecessary data in the device, e. g. files no longer used by the application.

children.name: Scalability
children.info: Ability to handle a growing amount of work.

children.name: Minimum requirements
children.info: Compliance with the minimum requirements, so that the application is used with no loss of performance.

children.name: Application coexistence
children.info: Ability to execute multiple instances simultaneously without affecting other applications.

children.name: Interoperability
children.info: Ability of expansion of an application through communication with other applications.

children.name: Inteligibility
children.info: Easy understanding of the key concepts of the use software and its use influenced by time and user's cognitive efforts towards learning the application use.

children.name: Screen loading
children.info: Amount of information and elements on a screen.

children.name: Easy form filling
children.info: Ability to facilitate the filling of data by user. The number of fields for data entry in the application is taken into consideration. Screen and keyboard limitations hamper the entry of data.

children.name: Navigability
children.info: Easy access to content and activities.

children.name: Continuity
children.info: Application flow which avoids navigation constraints.

children.name: Diversity of devices
children.info: Variety of devices, which improves exclusive usability according to the device used (example: Android x iOS back button).

children.name: Screens per task
children.info: Number of screens used in a task.

children.name: Information presentation
children.info: Limitation of information according to the screen display area.

children.name: Homogeneity of layout and components
children.info: Standardization of the appearance of components through the keeping of their characteristics for all application screens and standardization of the components due to the several types of components that provide the same functionality.

children.name: Attractiveness
children.info: Attractive and motivating application to the users.

children.name: Protection against user's error
children.info: User's protection against mistakes (example: inclusion of validations in open input fields).

children.name: Audiovisual quality
children.info: Use of quality media for the promotion of learning.

children.name: Accessibility
children.info: Accessibility mechanisms used by people with special needs.

children.name: Help
children.info: Help to users regarding use of the application.

children.name: Concise messages
children.info: Accurate and easy-to-understand application operational messages that speed up communication.

children.name: Stability
children.info: Absence of defects in the application.

children.name: Availability
children.info: Availability and accessibility anytime and anywhere.

children.name: Recovery time after disconnection
children.info: Connection reestablishment after disconnection. The operation is maintained, despite unexpected interruptions.

children.name: Data transfer
children.info: Data transfer, despite the occurrence of disconnections. The application must ensure data will not be lost, although the transfer is not possible,

children.name: Accuracy
children.info: Supply of accurate and error-free results.

children.name: Recoverability
children.info: Automatic or user-option saving of Backup points in case of low battery.

children.name: Fault tolerance
children.info: Reaction to an anomalous situation, ie, the application continues to run despite possible failures.

children.name: Confidentiality
children.info: Secure and private access for authorized users and applications.

children.name: Encryption
children.info: Use of encryption in sensitive data transferred and stored by the application (e.g. passwords or user documents).

children.name: Integrity
children.info: Use of different user's profiles, which restricts the access to certain features of the application.

children.name: Auditing
children.info: Record of each action in the application, which assists in the non-denial of action if the user denies it.

children.name: Traceability
children.info: Storage of records of events occurred in the application for the tracking of the user-made paths.

children.name: Authenticity
children.info: Guarantee of user's actions authenticity

children.name: Adaptability
children.info: Ability of application to adapt to different types of mobile devices.

children.name: Installability
children.info: Ability of application to be installed and uninstalled in different mobile devices with no errors.

children.name: Replaceability
children.info: Quick and automatic update and configuration.
